ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Specify Multiple Remote chronyd Or ntpd NTP Servers for Time Data
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Multiple remote chronyd or ntpd NTP Servers for time synchronization should be specified (and dependencies are met)

ns0:criteria.comment: chronyd enabled and multiple remote servers specified
ntpd enabled and multile remote servers specified

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Specify Remote NTP chronyd Or ntpd Server for Time Data
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: A remote chronyd or ntpd NTP Server for time synchronization should be specified (and dependencies are met)

ns0:criteria.comment: chronyd enabled and remote server specified
ntpd enabled and remote server specified

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure SELinux support is enabled in Docker
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The Docker daemon should be configured to start with --selinux-enabled option to enable SELinux for the daemon.

ns0:criterion.comment: Docker is configured to run with SELinux support

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Use direct-lvm with device mapper storage driver
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: To use Docker in production with the device mapper storage driver, the Docker daemon should be configured to use direct-lvm instead of loopback device as a storage.

ns0:extend_definition.comment: docker service is active on system

ns0:criterion.comment: Docker uses devicemapper as a storage driver
Docker is configured to use a thinpool device
The thinpool device configured to be used by Docker exists on the system
Docker does not use devicemapper as a storage driver

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Docker service is inactive on system

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Service chronyd Or Service ntpd Enabled
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: At least one of the chronyd or ntpd services should be enabled if possible.

ns0:criteria.comment: chronyd or ntpd service enabled

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Enable Smart Card Login
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Enable Smart Card logins

ns0:criteria.comment: smart card authentication is configured
smart card authentication is enabled or required in system-auth

ns0:criterion.comment: smart card authentication is enabled in /etc/pam.d/system-auth

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify The SSSD Configuration File Exists
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The /etc/sssd/sssd.conf file should exist if it is in use.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Configure SSSD's Memory Cache to Expire
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: SSSD's memory cache should be configured to set to expire records after 1 day.

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Check if sssd service is disabled
Check if /etc/sssd/sssd.conf is configured for usage

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Configure SSSD to Expire Offline Credentials
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: SSSD should be configured to expire offline credentials after 1 day.

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Check if sssd service is disabled
Check if /etc/sssd/sssd.conf is configured for usage

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Configure SSSD to Expire SSH Known Hosts
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: SSSD should be configured to expire keys from known SSH hosts after 1 day.

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Check if sssd service is disabled
Check if /etc/sssd/sssd.conf is configured for usage

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: All syslog log files should be owned by the appropriate group.

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: All syslog log files should be owned by the appropriate user.

ns0:criterion.comment: Check if all system log files are owned by root user

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: File permissions for all syslog log files should be set correctly.

ns0:criterion.comment: Check permissions of all system log files

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Service dovecot Disabled
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The dovecot service should be disabled if possible.

service dovecot is not configured to start

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable X Windows Startup By Setting Default SystemD Target
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Checks /etc/systemd/system/default.target to ensure that the default runlevel target is set to multi-user.target.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure that FAIL_DELAY is Configured in /etc/login.defs
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The delay between failed authentication attempts should be set for all users specified in /etc/login.defs

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Lock out the root account after failed login attempts
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The root account should be configured to deny access after the number of defined failed attempts has been reached.

ns0:criterion.comment: pam_faillock.so preauth silent set in system-auth
pam_faillock.so authfail deny_root value set in system-auth
pam_faillock.so preauth silent set in password-auth
pam_faillock.so authfail deny_root value set in password-auth

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure YUM Removes Previous Package Versions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The clean_requirements_on_remove option should be used to ensure that old versions of software components are removed after updating.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure gpgcheck Enabled for Local Packages
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The localpkg_gpgcheck option should be used to ensure that checking of an RPM package's signature always occurs prior to its installation.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure gpgcheck Enabled for Repository Metadata
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The repo_gpgcheck option should be used to ensure that checking of repository metadata always occurs.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify group who owns 'cron.allow' file
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The /etc/cron.allow file should be owned by the appropriate group.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify user who owns 'cron.allow' file
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The /etc/cron.allow file should be owned by the appropriate user.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: SSH Server Private Key Permissions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: File permissions for the SSH Server's private keys should be set to 0640 (or stronger). By default, these files are located at /etc/ssh.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: SSHD Service Public Key Permissions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: File permissions for the SSH Server's public keys should be set to 0644 (or stronger). By default, these files are located at /etc/ssh.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Find setgid files system packages
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: All files with setgid should be owned by a base system package

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Find setuid files from system packages
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: All files with setuid should be owned by a base system package

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Enable FIPS Mode in GRUB2
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Look for argument fips=1 in the kernel line in /etc/default/grub.

ns0:criterion.comment: check for fips=1 in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX
check for fips=1 in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT
check for fips=1 in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Package kernel-PAE Installed

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable Printer Browsing Entirely if Possible
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The CUPS print service can be configured to broadcast a list of available printers to the network. Other machines on the network, also running the CUPS print service, can be configured to listen to these broadcasts and add and configure these printers for immediate use. By disabling this browsing capability, the machine will no longer generate or receive such broadcasts.

ns0:criterion.comment: Ensure remote printer browsing is off
Ensure no incoming printer information packets are allowed

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable Printer Server if Possible
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: By default, locally configured printers will not be shared over the network, but if this functionality has somehow been enabled, these recommendations will disable it again. Be sure to disable outgoing printer list broadcasts, or remote users will still be able to see the locally configured printers, even if they cannot actually print to them. To limit print serving to a particular set of users, use the Policy directive.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify /var/log/audit Ownership
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Checks that all /var/log/audit files and directories are owned by the root user and group.

ns0:criteria.comment: directories are root owned
log_group in auditd.conf is not root

ns0:extend_definition.comment: log_group in auditd.conf is not root

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify that System Executables Have Restrictive Permissions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Checks that binary files under /bin, /sbin, /usr/bin, /usr/sbin, /usr/local/bin, /usr/local/sbin, and /usr/libexec are not group-writable or world-writable.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify permissions on 'group' file
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: File permissions for /etc/group should be set correctly.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify /etc/gshadow Permissions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: This test makes sure that /etc/gshadow is owned by 0, group owned by 0, and has mode 0000. If the target file or directory has an extended ACL then it will fail the mode check.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify /etc/passwd Permissions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: This test makes sure that /etc/passwd is owned by 0, group owned by 0, and has mode 0644 (or stronger). If the target file or directory has an extended ACL then it will fail the mode check.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: File grub.cfg Permissions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: File permissions for grub.cfg should be set to 0600 (or stronger). By default, this file is located at /boot/grub2/grub.cfg or, for EFI systems, at /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grub.cfg

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Proper Permissions User Home Directories
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: File permissions should be set correctly for the home directories for all user accounts.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify Permissions On Apache Web Server Configuration Files
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The /etc/httpd/conf.d/* files should have the appropriate permissions (0640 or stronger).

ns0:extend_definition.comment: httpd not present or in use

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify Permissions On Apache Web Server Configuration Files
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The /etc/httpd/conf/* files should have the appropriate permissions (0640 or stronger).

ns0:extend_definition.comment: httpd not present or in use

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify Permissions On Apache Web Server Configuration Files
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The /etc/httpd/conf.modules.d/* files should have the appropriate permissions (0640 or stronger).

ns0:extend_definition.comment: httpd not present or in use

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify that Shared Library Files Have Restrictive Permissions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Checks that /lib, /lib64, /usr/lib, /usr/lib64, /lib/modules, and objects therein, are not group-writable or world-writable.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Find Unauthorized World-Writable Files
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The world-write permission should be disabled for all files.

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: All files should be owned by a group

ns0:criterion.comment: Check all files and make sure they are owned by a group

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Checks for correct permissions for all log files in /var/log/audit.

ns0:criteria.comment: log_group in auditd.conf is not root

ns0:extend_definition.comment: log_group in auditd.conf is not root

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: File grub.cfg Owned By root User
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The grub.cfg file should be owned by the root user. By default, this file is located at /boot/grub2/grub.cfg or, for EFI systems, at /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grub.cfg

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disallow inbound firewall access to the SSH Server port

ssh port is enabled in services

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure Logwatch HostLimit Configured
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Test if HostLimit line in logwatch.conf is set appropriately.

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Check if SplitHosts line in logwatch.conf is set appropriately.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add nodev Option to /dev/shm
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Legitimate character and block devices should not exist within temporary directories like /dev/shm. The nodev mount option should be specified for /dev/shm.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add noexec Option to /dev/shm
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: It can be dangerous to allow the execution of binaries from world-writable temporary storage directories such as /dev/shm. The noexec mount option prevents binaries from being executed out of /dev/shm.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add nosuid Option to /dev/shm
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The nosuid mount option should be set for temporary storage partitions such as /dev/shm. The suid/sgid permissions should not be required in these world-writable directories.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add nosuid Option to /home
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The nosuid mount option should be set for user home directory partitions such as /home. The suid/sgid permissions should not be required in these directories.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add nodev Option to Non-Root Local Partitions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The nodev mount option prevents files from being interpreted as character or block devices. Legitimate character and block devices should exist in the /dev directory on the root partition or within chroot jails built for system services. All other locations should not allow character and block devices.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Mount Remote Filesystems with nodev
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The nodev option should be enabled for all NFS mounts in /etc/fstab.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add nodev Option to Removable Media Partitions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The nodev mount option prevents files from being interpreted as character or block devices. Legitimate character and block devices should exist in the /dev directory on the root partition or within chroot jails built for system services. All other locations should not allow character and block devices.

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Check if removable partition really exists on the system
Check if removable partition value represents CD/DVD drive

ns0:criterion.comment: Check if at least one from CD/DVD drive alternative names is using 'nodev' mount option in /etc/fstab
Check if at least one from CD/DVD drive alternative names is using 'nodev' mount option in runtime configuration

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Check if CD/DVD drive is not configured to automount in /etc/fstab

ns0:criterion.comment: Check if removable partition is using 'nodev' mount option in /etc/fstab
Check if removable partition is using 'nodev' mount option in runtime configuration

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Mount Remote Filesystems with noexec
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The noexec option should be enabled for all NFS mounts in /etc/fstab.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add noexec Option to Removable Media Partitions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The noexec mount option prevents the direct execution of binaries on the mounted filesystem. Users should not be allowed to execute binaries that exist on partitions mounted from removable media (such as a USB key). The noexec option prevents code from being executed directly from the media itself, and may therefore provide a line of defense against certain types of worms or malicious code.

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Check if removable partition really exists on the system
Check if removable partition value represents CD/DVD drive

ns0:criterion.comment: Check if at least one from CD/DVD drive alternative names is using 'noexec' mount option in /etc/fstab
Check if at least one from CD/DVD drive alternative names is using 'noexec' mount option in runtime configuration

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Check if CD/DVD drive is not configured to automount in /etc/fstab

ns0:criterion.comment: Check if removable partition is using 'noexec' mount option in /etc/fstab
Check if removable partition is using 'noexec' mount option in runtime configuration

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Mount Remote Filesystems with nosuid
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The nosuid option should be enabled for all NFS mounts in /etc/fstab.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add nosuid Option to Removable Media Partitions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The nosuid mount option prevents set-user-identifier (suid) and set-group-identifier (sgid) permissions from taking effect. These permissions allow users to execute binaries with the same permissions as the owner and group of the file respectively. Users should not be allowed to introduce suid and guid files into the system via partitions mounted from removeable media.

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Check if removable partition really exists on the system
Check if removable partition value represents CD/DVD drive

ns0:criterion.comment: Check if at least one from CD/DVD drive alternative names is using 'nosuid' mount option in /etc/fstab
Check if at least one from CD/DVD drive alternative names is using 'nosuid' mount option in runtime configuration

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Check if CD/DVD drive is not configured to automount in /etc/fstab

ns0:criterion.comment: Check if removable partition is using 'nosuid' mount option in /etc/fstab
Check if removable partition is using 'nosuid' mount option in runtime configuration

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Require Client SMB Packet Signing, if using mount.cifs
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Require packet signing of clients who mount Samba shares using the mount.cifs program (e.g., those who specify shares in /etc/fstab). To do so, ensure that signing options (either sec=krb5i or sec=ntlmv2i) are used.

ns0:criterion.comment: check for sec=krb5i or sec=ntlmv2i in /etc/fstab
check for sec=krb5i or sec=ntlmv2i in /etc/mtab

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add nodev Option to /tmp
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Legitimate character and block devices should not exist within temporary directories like /tmp. The nodev mount option should be specified for /tmp.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add noexec Option to /tmp
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: It can be dangerous to allow the execution of binaries from world-writable temporary storage directories such as /tmp. The noexec mount option prevents binaries from being executed out of /tmp.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add nosuid Option to /tmp
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The nosuid mount option should be set for temporary storage partitions such as /tmp. The suid/sgid permissions should not be required in these world-writable directories.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Bind Mount /var/tmp To /tmp
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The /var/tmp directory should be bind mounted to /tmp in order to consolidate temporary storage into one location protected by the same techniques as /tmp.

ns0:criterion.comment: Ensure /var/tmp and /tmp have the same source device

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Multiple Domain Name System (DNS) Servers should be configured in /etc/resolv.conf.

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Disable the network sniffer

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure /home Located On Separate Partition
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: If user home directories will be stored locally, create a separate partition for /home. If /home will be mounted from another system such as an NFS server, then creating a separate partition is not necessary at this time, and the mountpoint can instead be configured later.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure /tmp Located On Separate Partition
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The /tmp directory is a world-writable directory used for temporary file storage. Verify that it has its own partition or logical volume.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure /var Located On Separate Partition
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Ensuring that /var is mounted on its own partition enables the setting of more restrictive mount options, which is used as temporary storage by many program, particularly system services such as daemons. It is not uncommon for the /var directory to contain world-writable directories, installed by other software packages.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure /var/log Located On Separate Partition
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: System logs are stored in the /var/log directory. Ensure that it has its own partition or logical volume.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure /var/log/audit Located On Separate Partition
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit logs are stored in the /var/log/audit directory. Ensure that it has its own partition or logical volume. Make absolutely certain that it is large enough to store all audit logs that will be created by the auditing daemon.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Configure Postfix Against Unnecessary Release of Information
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Protect against unnecessary release of information.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Device Files for Removable Media Partitions Does Not Exist on the System
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Verify if device file representing removable partitions exist on the system

ns0:criterion.comment: Check if removable partition really exists on the system

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Require Authentication for Single-User Mode
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The requirement for a password to boot into single-user mode should be configured correctly.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Require Client SMB Packet Signing in smb.conf
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Require samba clients which use smb.conf, such as smbclient, to use packet signing. A Samba client should only communicate with servers who can support SMB packet signing.

ns0:criterion.comment: check for client signing = mandatory in /etc/samba/smb.conf

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Restrict Serial Port Root Logins
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Preventing direct root login to serial port interfaces helps ensure accountability for actions taken on the system using the root account.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure that No Dangerous Directories Exist in Root's Path
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The environment variable PATH should be set correctly for the root user.

ns0:criteria.comment: environment variable PATH contains dangerous path

ns0:criterion.comment: environment variable PATH starts with : or .
environment variable PATH contains : twice in a row
environment variable PATH contains . twice in a row
environment variable PATH ends with : or .
environment variable PATH doesn't begin with a /
environment variable PATH doesn't contain relative paths

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify File Hashes with RPM
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Verify the RPM digests of system binaries using the RPM database.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify File Ownership And Permissions Using RPM
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Verify the integrity of installed packages by comparing the installed files with information about the files taken from the package metadata stored in the RPM database.

ns0:criterion.comment: user ownership of all files matches local rpm database
group ownership of all files matches local rpm database
mode of all files matches local rpm database

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable Rsyslogd from Accepting Remote Messages on Loghosts Only
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: rsyslogd should reject remote messages

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Send Logs to a Remote Loghost
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Syslog logs should be sent to a remote loghost

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Restrict Virtual Console Root Logins
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Preventing direct root login to virtual console devices helps ensure accountability for actions taken on the system using the root account.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Device Files Have Proper SELinux Context
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: All device files in /dev should be assigned an SELinux security context other than 'device_t'.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure No Daemons are Unconfined by SELinux
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: All pids in /proc should be assigned an SELinux security context other than 'initrc_t'.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Enable SELinux
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The SELinux policy should be set appropriately.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: SELinux Enforcing
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The SELinux state should be enforcing the local policy.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Change the default firewalld zone to drop

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set SHA512 Password Hashing Algorithm in /etc/libuser.conf
